item.title: Show specific labels in large plots in Excel
item.description: Suppose you need to highlight specific labels in a large bar or column chart in Excel. Here is a two-step way to accomplish the task. With the COUNT.IF formula, you can detect if the current label belongs to a list of specific ones. The neat trick, however, is in the number formatting used to show the labels of interest exclusively: [=0]"";0% The formatting makes the cell show empty when zero (default output of the COUNT.
